TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CatalogConnectionManager extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Manages catalog connections that are used in a site collection.

remarks.para: Catalog connections can be used to define result sources that can be used in the Content Search Web Part and other search-driven Web Parts. Catalog connections also define how URLs to items in a catalog are rewritten on a site.

example.para: The following example contains several methods that demonstrate using the CatalogConnectionManager class to create and connect to subscriptions to a catalog from a publishing site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed

Docs.param: The object for which catalog connections are managed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a object that manages catalogs that are used in the site collection as specified in the parameter.

remarks.para: Manage catalogs used in the site collection that are specified by a site. Use this class to add, edit, or delete catalog connections in the site collection. When a new collection is added, a result source is automatically created.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site, bool createResultSource) cil managed
Public Sub New (site As SPSite, createResultSource As Boolean)

Docs.param: An object for which catalog connections are managed.
Whether a result source is created for new catalog connections.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object that manages catalogs that are used in the site collection as specified by the parameter.

remarks.para: Use CatalogConnectManager class to add, edit, or delete catalog connections within the site collection. When a new connection is added, a result source is created based on parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddCatalogConnection(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings catalogInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: Settings for the catalog that is being added.
Docs.summary: Add a catalog connection to the site that is specified in the constructor.

remarks.para: Use the GetPublishingCatalog(Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite,System.String) method to return catalog information and default settings.
The connection is committed to the term store when the method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddCatalogConnection (Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings catalogInfo, string[] orderedPropertiesForUrlRewrite, string webUrl, string catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty);

.method public hidebysig instance void AddCatalogConnection(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings catalogInfo, string[] orderedPropertiesForUrlRewrite, string webUrl, string catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty) cil managed
Public Sub AddCatalogConnection (catalogInfo As CatalogConnectionSettings, orderedPropertiesForUrlRewrite As String(), webUrl As String, catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty As String)

public: void AddCatalogConnection(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::CatalogConnectionSettings ^ catalogInfo, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ orderedPropertiesForUrlRewrite, System::String ^ webUrl, System::String ^ catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty);
member this.AddCatalogConnection : Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings * string[] * string * string -> unit

Docs.param: The connection settings to add. Settings to add should include the property, the property, the property, which are returned by the PublishingCatalogUtility.GetPublishingCatalog method. This parameter should not be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Catalog item key fields that are used to generate friendly URLs for items in this catalog. The URL will be rewritten by using these property values in the same order.
Server-relative URL of the web that form the base URL of the friendly URL for items in this catalog.
Managed property name of the taxonomy field that contains category information for catalog items.
Docs.summary: Adds a catalog connection to the site that is specified in the constructor.

remarks.para: Use the GetPublishingCatalog method to get catalog information.
The connection is added to the store when the method is called.

Throws aArgumentNullException exception if the parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). URL rewrite is enabled only if non-empty values for the parameter, the parameter, and the parameter are passed in.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddCatalogConnection (Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings catalogInfo, string catalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate, string webServerRelativeUrl, string catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty, bool isCustomCatalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate);

.method public hidebysig instance void AddCatalogConnection(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings catalogInfo, string catalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate, string webServerRelativeUrl, string catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty, bool isCustomCatalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate) cil managed

Public Sub AddCatalogConnection (catalogInfo As CatalogConnectionSettings, catalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate As String, webServerRelativeUrl As String, catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty As String, isCustomCatalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate As Boolean)

public: void AddCatalogConnection(Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::CatalogConnectionSettings ^ catalogInfo, System::String ^ catalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate, System::String ^ webServerRelativeUrl, System::String ^ catalogTaxonomyManagedProperty, bool isCustomCatalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate);
member this.AddCatalogConnection : Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings * string * string * string * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The connection settings to be added. This should include the property, the property, and the property, which are returned by the PublishingCatalogUtility.GetPublishingCatalog method. This parameter should not be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

URL rewrite template to use to generate friendly URLs for items in this catalog. Any search managed property that is enclosed in "[", "]" are replaced dynamically. If isCustomCatalogItemUrlRewriteTemplate=true, then the template can be a web-relative page URL that can render different items based on a dynamic query parameter.
The server-relative URL of the web connecting to this catalog. If item URLs are rewritten by using managed navigation friendly URLs, the managed navigation settings for this object will be used.
The search managed property name of the taxonomy field that contains category information for catalog items.
Indicates whether the URL rewrite template is based on structured navigation. This parameter sets the property.
Docs.summary: Adds a catalog connection to the site that is specified in the constructor.

remarks.para: Use the method to get catalog information.
The connection is added to store when an method is called.

Throws anArgumentNullException if the parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). URL rewrite is enabled only if non-empty values for the parameter, the parameter, and the parameter are passed in.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ConnectedPublishingCatalogs As List(Of CatalogConnectionSettings)

Docs.summary: Returns publishing catalogs that are connected to the site that is supplied to the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(string catalogPath) cil managed
Public Function Contains (catalogPath As String) As Boolean

Docs.param: The URL that identifies the catalog as the URL is stored in the search index. If the catalog is a object, then this is the absolute URL.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a connection to the catalog exists in the site that is specified in the constructor.
Docs.returns: true if a connection to the catalog exists in the site that is specified in the constructor; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Committed to the term store when the method is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteCatalogConnection(string catalogPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The URL that identifies the catalog that is being removed as the URL is stored in the search index. If the catalog is an object, the URL is the absolute path.
Docs.summary: Removes a catalog connection and the associated search result source from the site specified in the constructor.

remarks.para: Committed when the method is called.
If the catalog is configured to rewrite item URLs, then any Web Part that renders items from this catalog shows original URLs after the connection is removed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings GetCatalogConnectionSettings(string catalogPath) cil managed
Public Function GetCatalogConnectionSettings (catalogPath As String) As CatalogConnectionSettings

Docs.param: URL that identifies the catalog as the URL is stored in the search index. If the catalog is a object, then this URL is the absolute URL.
Docs.summary: Gets the settings for a catalog that is connected to this site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Update() cil managed

Docs.summary: Commits changes to the catalog connection settings for the site specified in the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UpdateCatalogConnection(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.CatalogConnectionSettings catalogInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: The connection settings to be updated. Use the method to return the current settings for this catalog.
Docs.summary: Updates the catalog that is currently connected to the site that is specified in the constructor.

remarks.para: Committed when the method is called.
